consent.title: Before we Begin
consent.text: To use our IEP Helper tool, we need your permission. By checking this box, you allow us to process your child's IEP information to provide personalized support and recommendations. We keep all information private and secure. You can withdraw your consent at any time by contacting us.
consent.tooltip: Please check the box to continue

tutorial.appTutorial.title: What are we doing right now ?
tutorial.parentRights.title: Your rights as a parent:
rights.title: Your Rights as a Parent
rights.description: Hi! We're here to help you understand your child's Individualized Education Program (IEP) better. Navigating this process can feel overwhelming, but you have important rights as a parent. Here are some things you should know:
rights.bulletPoints.1: You can request a translator for IEP meetings to ensure clear communication.
rights.bulletPoints.2: You have the right to take your time before signing an IEP - you don't need to sign until you're ready.
rights.bulletPoints.3: You can consent to all, some, or none of the proposed services - your child won't receive new services without your approval.
rights.bulletPoints.4: You have the right to request an IEP meeting at any time, not just at the annual review, and the school must schedule it within 30 days.
rights.bulletPoints.5: If an administrator isn't present at the meeting, you have the right to reschedule for a time when they can attend.
rights.bulletPoints.6: By law, your case manager must provide you with a booklet of your parental rights before the IEP meeting.
summary.noDocuments: No documents found. Please upload an IEP document first.
summary.processing.title: Document is being processed
summary.processing.message: This may take a few minutes. Meanwhile, please take a look at your rights as a parent:
summary.processing.hangTight: Hang tight! We are processing the document . . .
summary.processing.almostThere: Almost there! We're now translating your document...
summary.failed.title: Processing Failed
summary.failed.message: There was an error processing your document. Please try uploading it again.
summary.noTranslatedSummary.title: No Translated Summary Available
summary.noTranslatedSummary.message: No summary in your preferred language was found for this document.
summary.noContent: No content available for this section.
summary.noTranslatedSections.title: No Translated Sections Available
summary.noTranslatedSections.message: No sections in your preferred language were found for this document.
summary.noSummary.title: No Summary Available
summary.noSummary.message: No English summary was found for this document.
summary.noSections.title: No Sections Available
summary.noSections.message: No English sections were found for this document.
summary.noContentAvailable.title: No Content Available
summary.noContentAvailable.message: The document has been processed, but no summary or sections were found in any language.
summary.reuploadSuggestion: To get content in your preferred language, please re-upload your IEP document:
summary.noPreferredLanguageContent.title: Content Not Available in Your Preferred Language
summary.noPreferredLanguageContent.messa: This document was processed before your language preference was set. Re-upload your document to get it translated into your preferred language.

current.noDocument: No IEP document found. Please upload a document to get started.
current.paragraph1: This action will replace your current IEP document and generate a new summary.
current.paragraph2: You can request it from your case worker at any time.

profile.title: Profile Information
revoke.title: Revoke Consent
revoke.description1: By revoking your consent, you will no longer be able to use the IEP Helper tool. Your data will be deleted from our system.
revoke.description2: Revoking consent will immediately sign you out of the application. You can restore your consent by logging back in and accepting the consent form.
revoke.error.failed: Failed to revoke consent. Please try again.
delete.title: Delete Account
delete.description1: ⚠️ This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
delete.description2: Deleting your account will permanently remove:
delete.item2: • All uploaded IEP documents and files
delete.error.failed: Failed to delete account. Please try again.

onboarding.carousel.paragraph.accessible: The AIEP tool can help you understand your child or student's IEP documents.
onboarding.carousel.paragraph.summarize: The tool will break down the key aspects of your IEP document into easy-to-understand language.
onboarding.carousel.paragraph.translate: AIEP can also translate the summaries of IEP documents into your the language of your choice.
onboarding.carousel.paragraph.advocate: Advocate for your child's education by exploring the IEP and understanding your rights.
rights.header.title.green: Your data is safe with us
rights.slide1.title: You can request a translator
rights.slide1.content: You can request a translator for IEP meetings to ensure clear communication.
rights.slide2.title: You can take your time
rights.slide2.content: You have the right to take your time before signing an IEP - you don't need to sign until you're ready.
rights.slide3.title: You can consent or not
rights.slide3.content: You can consent to all, some, or none of the proposed services - your child won't receive new services without your approval.
rights.slide4.title: You can request a meeting
rights.slide4.content: You have the right to request an IEP meeting at any time, not just at the annual review, and the school must schedule it within 30 days.
rights.slide5.title: You can reschedule
rights.slide5.content: If an administrator isn't present at the meeting, you have the right to reschedule for a time when they can attend.
rights.slide6.title: You must be given a booklet of your rights
rights.slide6.content: By law, your case manager must provide you with a booklet of your parental rights before the IEP meeting.
privacy.slide1.title: Your IEP won’t be changed
privacy.slide1.content: We’re creating a separate document with your summary. You will be able to download it as a PDF.
privacy.slide2.title: We care about your privacy
privacy.slide2.content: We’re removing your personal information from the summaries. We will not store any of your or your child’s personal details.
appTutorial.slide1.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide1.content: We're summarizing the key aspects of your IEP. You'll first see a general overview of the document, and then a summary for each one of the key sections.
appTutorial.slide2.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide2.content: We're including the pages where we found the information we're about to show. That way, you can double check the information in case something doesn't make sense.
appTutorial.slide3.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide3.content: We're translating the summaries to your language. The IEP document will remain in English, but the summaries we created will be translated to the language of your choice.
appTutorial.slide4.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide4.content: We're removing your personal information from the summaries. You can rest assured that we will not store any of your or your child's personal details.
appTutorial.slide5.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide5.content: Your IEP document won't be changed. You can download the summaries we're creating by clicking on the download button.
appTutorial.slide6.title: What are we doing right now?
appTutorial.slide6.content: We're creating a glossary to help you understand the document. You can click over the highlighted words and read their definitions on the panel that will emerge.
footer.tagline:
Designing AI
with and for
communities
accountCenter.title: Account Center
supportCenter.title: Support Center
about.projectTitle:
The AI-EP Project: Designing AI
with and for Communities
about.title: About The Project
about.intro: With the support of the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, the Burnes Center for Social Change, its AI for Impact program, and Innovate Public Schools are working with families in California and Massachusetts to use artificial intelligence to enhance educational outcomes for learners with disabilities. At the same time, we are learning how to develop public purpose AI with communities.
about.problemDescription: With engagement from 1000+ parents, our team is building a free, open source AI-powered tool together with parents and caregivers that will:
about.problemList.conversation: Enable natural conversation with the document through text or voice
about.problemList.recommendations: Create personalized recommendations and meeting checklists
about.empowerFamilies: We want to empower families to advocate effectively for their children's education. The Community-Centered AI project is about reimagining how AI is developed. By positioning affected communities as architects of their own solutions, we're working toward a future where responsible AI goes beyond mitigating risks and actively advances equity and empowerment.
about.researchDescription: At the same time, we are studying:
about.researchList.educate: How can we effectively educate community members about AI so they can meaningfully participate in its development?
about.researchList.codesign: What methods make co-design processes efficient and respectful of community members' time?
about.researchList.amplify: How can we leverage AI to amplify diverse community voices?
about.researchList.translateInsights: How can we translate community insights into practical technological solutions?
about.researchList.equity: What strategies increase equity in AI design, especially for vulnerable populations?
about.projectOutcomes: In addition to the free AI-EP tool, the project will produce a course and curriculum for community AI training and a playbook for community-centered AI development.
about.description: AI-IEP makes Individualized Education Program documents easier to understand through AI-powered translation, simplified language, and helpful resources for parents.
about.thankYouAdvocating: Thank you for advocating for children's right to education!
about.thankYouMessage: Your dedication to understanding and navigating your child's IEP makes a real difference. Together, we're ensuring every child has access to the quality education they deserve.
about.innovatePublicSchoolsDescription: Innovate Public Schools is a nonprofit organization dedicated to building the capacity of parents and families to organize, advocate, and demand high quality schools for their children.
about.theGovLabDescription: The GovLab's mission is to improve people's lives by changing the way we govern. Our goal is to strengthen the ability of institutions – including but not limited to governments – and people to work more openly, collaboratively, effectively and legitimately to make better decisions and solve public problems.
resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Access essential tools and guides to help you advocate for your child's special education needs. These resources provide valuable information about your parental rights, advocacy strategies, and practical tips for navigating the IEP process effectively.
resources.toolkit.title: Special Education Basics Toolkit
resources.toolkit.description: Comprehensive collection of advocacy tools, timelines, template letters, and worksheets to help you navigate the special education process effectively.
resources.walletCard.title: Know Your Rights Wallet Card
resources.walletCard.description: Printable reference card explaining your disability rights under the ADA, including accommodations you can request in public spaces and services.
resources.advocacyTips.title: 17 Special Education Advocacy Tips
resources.advocacyTips.description: Essential strategies for before, during, and after IEP meetings to help you effectively advocate for your child's educational needs.
resources.rulaManual.title: Rights Under the Lanterman Act Manual (RULA)
resources.rulaManual.description: Detailed guide to understanding your rights and services available under California's Lanterman Developmental Disabilities Services Act.
updateProfile.title: Update Profile
updateProfile.description: Your name or personal information will not be linked to any IEP summaries. It will only be used to tailor our messages for you on this app.
changeLanguage.title: Your Language
changeLanguage.description: The original summary of your IEP will always be generated in English. We can translate this summary to the language of your choice.
deleteAccount.title: Delete Account
deleteAccount.description: This action will delete your account, as well as any information linked to it on our servers. You cannot undo this action, but you can create a new account.
deleteAccount.title: Delete Account
deleteAccount.description: This action will delete your account, as well as any information linked to it on our servers.
deleteAccount.alternative: but you can create a new account.
privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy for The GovLab AIEP
privacyPolicy.intro: At The GovLab, we take your privacy seriously. This policy outlines how we handle, use, and protect your information when you use the AIEP application.
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.title: How We Handle Your Individualized Education Program (IEP) Documents
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.subtitle: Documents
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.item1: When you upload an IEP PDF, we immediately create a text version using OCR (Optical Character Recognition) and delete the original PDF right away.
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.item2: We do not store any PDFs of IEPs.
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.item3: Before anything is processed further, we run the text through a tool from AWS that removes personal information (like addresses, social security numbers and phone numbers) — though we keep names in the document to make it useful. (Using AWS Comprehend)
privacyPolicy.iepDocuments.item4: Only this cleaned-up version of the IEP is sent to our language models for processing.
privacyPolicy.languageModels.title: The Language Models We Use
privacyPolicy.languageModels.item1: We use Mistral's enterprise version and the OpenAI API for language processing.
privacyPolicy.languageModels.item2: Neither company trains their AI models using the documents we send them. Your data stays private and is not reused for any future AI training.
privacyPolicy.security.title: How We Keep Everything Secure
privacyPolicy.security.intro: We have strong protections in place at every level:
privacyPolicy.security.access.title: Access and Identity Protection
privacyPolicy.security.access.item1: Role-based access control and multi-factor authentication:
privacyPolicy.security.access.item1.desc: Only the right people can access systems, and they must verify their identity.
privacyPolicy.security.access.item2.desc: Your data is protected both when it's being sent between services and when it's stored.
privacyPolicy.security.access.item3.desc: We keep detailed logs to track access and actions for security and accountability.
privacyPolicy.security.infrastructure.it: Our systems are built in a repeatable, reviewable way.
We keep development and live environments separate to prevent accidental leaks.
All code changes go through automated testing and tracking before being deployed.
privacyPolicy.security.monitoring.title: Monitoring and Response
We watch for security threats and can act quickly.
If something happens, we have a clear process to investigate and fix it.
privacyPolicy.security.problems.title: Finding and Fixing Problems Early
privacyPolicy.security.problems.item1.de: We regularly scan our systems for vulnerabilities.
privacyPolicy.security.problems.item2.de: Passwords and sensitive configuration details are securely stored and protected.
privacyPolicy.security.sensitive.title: Extra Steps for Handling Sensitive Information
privacyPolicy.security.sensitive.item1.d: Only people who absolutely need to see PHI can access it.
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.title: How We Handle Phone Numbers (SMS Consent & Use)
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.item1: We only ask for your phone number if you choose to create an account using your phone instead of an email address.
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.item2: We do not use your phone number for any purpose other than sending you One-Time Passcodes (OTPs) to verify your identity.
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.item3: We never share or sell phone numbers, and we do not use them for marketing or communication outside of login verification.
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.item4: Phone numbers are securely stored and encrypted, just like all other sensitive information.
privacyPolicy.phoneNumbers.item5: You will only receive one SMS per login attempt.
privacyPolicy.rights.title: Your Rights and Choices
privacyPolicy.rights.item1: You may request that we delete your data at any time.
privacyPolicy.rights.item2: You may opt out of SMS by replying STOP to any message. For assistance, reply HELP or contact us at info@thegovlab.org.
privacyPolicy.contact.title: Contact
privacyPolicy.contact.intro: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:
hero.title:
Individualized Education
Plans, made accessible
hero.description: The AIEP tool can help you understand your child's IEP documents.
landing.greenBanner.title: All children deserve education, regardless of their needs
landing.greenBanner.description: Just like plants, each child learns in their own way. Some need light, some need shade, some bloom quickly, others take time. The AIEP tool helps families care for their child's educational needs.
